discussion.content: The file plan template is a comma separated value (CSV) file. You download it from the file plan page of the records management solution.
Looks good~
On exam 1/20/2022

questions.question_text:
You need to recommend a solution to configure the Microsoft 365 Records management settings by using the CSV file. The solution must meet the compliance requirements.
What should you recommend?

choices.D: Use a PowerShell command that pipes the Import-Csv cmdlet to the New-Label cmdlet.
choices.C: From the Microsoft 365 compliance center, import the CSV file to a file plan.
choices.B: Use a PowerShell command that pipes the Import-Csv cmdlet to the New-RetentionPolicy cmdlet.
choices.A: Use EdmUploadAgent.exe to upload a hash of the CSV to a datastore.

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription that uses Microsoft Purview. The subscription contains two groups named Group1 and Group2.

You need to implement a policy to detect messages that present a conflict of interest between the users in Group1 and the users in Group2.

What should you use in the Microsoft Purview compliance portal?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. Communication Compliance
One of the in-built policies of Communication Compliance is "Detect Conflict of Interest". So , just apply that policy and it meets the requirements for this scenario.

Selected Answer: D
Communication compliance is the answer

Selected Answer: C
chatgpt would select C:
The correct option for implementing a policy to detect messages that present a conflict of interest between users in different groups in the Microsoft 365 E5 subscription using Microsoft Purview is:

C. Information barriers

Information barriers allow you to create policies that restrict communication and sharing of information between different groups, such as Group1 and Group2, to prevent conflicts of interest or other compliance concerns. This feature helps control the flow of sensitive information within an organization.

Selected Answer: D
The goal is to detect, not always block potential conflicts of interest between the groups. Communication Compliance is the best answer.

comments.content: In the context of your previous question, if your goal is to detect messages that present a conflict of interest between the users in Group1 and the users in Group2, then Communication Compliance would be a better solution as it allows you to monitor and review communications between these groups. Information barriers, on the other hand, would prevent communication between these groups altogether. Ultimately, the best solution for your needs would depend on your specific requirements and goals.

On the other hand, Information barriers are policies that restrict communication and collaboration between specific groups of users. These policies can help prevent conflicts of interest by blocking communication between users in different groups or departments.

Communication Compliance is a feature that allows you to define policies to automatically detect and capture communications that may present a conflict of interest. It can help you monitor and review communications between users in different groups to ensure compliance with your organization's policies and regulations.

discussion.content:
Asked copilot, would select D.
"Both Communication Compliance and Information barriers can be used to manage conflicts of interest between different groups of users in a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription. However, they serve different purposes and work in different ways."
C is correct~

Selected Answer: C
Information Barriers is what this defines.

comments.content: Information Barriers blocks all traffic and that is not the question. Only specific messages should be blocked and therefor a communication Compliance is required

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Microsoft Purview Communication Compliance is an insider risk solution that helps minimize communication risks by helping you detect, capture, and act on potentially inappropriate messages in your organization.

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/purview/communication-compliance

Selected Answer: C
C. 
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/purview/information-barriers
Information Barriers (IB) is a compliance solution that allows you to restrict two-way communication and collaboration between groups
on the exam thu nov 9
Information barriers is the correct answer

comments.content: The requirement is to "detect" messages, which is Communication Compliance. Information Barriers will block communication.

Priva Privacy Risk Management is an add-on that is NOT included in E3/E5 and can be bought separately

Selected Answer: B
Priva Privacy Risk Management is an add-on license that can be added to E5. Compliance manager is already include with E5.

Selected Answer: C
To identify personal data stored in a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription and control the transfer of personal data between users and groups, you should acquire:

C. Microsoft 365 E5 Compliance

ChatGPT: 
To identify personal data stored in the Microsoft 365 subscription and control the transfer of personal data between users and groups, you should acquire the following license:

C. Microsoft 365 E5 Compliance

The Microsoft 365 E5 Compliance license provides a comprehensive set of tools and features for data governance, including identifying and protecting personal data, controlling data transfers, and managing compliance with privacy regulations.

Selected Answer: C
Microsoft 365 E5 Compliance provides the capabilities we're looking for.

Option B, Priva Privacy Risk Management, is not a license type available in Microsoft 365. Microsoft 365 E5 Compliance is the correct license to acquire for identifying personal data stored in the subscription and controlling the transfer of personal data between users and groups. It provides access to advanced compliance features such as Information Protection, Data Loss Prevention, and eDiscovery, which can help you to identify, classify, and protect personal data, and to control the transfer of personal data between users and groups.

--> C is correct.

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription.

You need to identify personal data stored in the subscription and control the transfer of personal data between users and groups.

Which type of license should you acquire?

You have a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription that contains a Microsoft SharePoint Online site named Site1.

You create an information barrier segment named Segment1.

You need to add Segment1 to Site1.

What should you do first?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Think this one is B
To enable information barriers in SharePoint and OneDrive, run the following command:
Set-SPOTenant -InformationBarriersSuspension $false 
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/purview/information-barriers-sharepoint

Selected Answer: C
C is correct.

Selected Answer: B
Ok I belive correct answer is "B. Run Set-SPOTenant" as the question asks "what should you do first".
By default information barriers are not enabled in SPO and OneDrive, so we need to enable it using command: Set-SPOTenant -InformationBarriersSuspension $false 
Option C, is anyways wrong as Information barrier policy defines which segment can interact with which other segments. Assigning segment to SharePoint site does not need information barrier policy. The question specifically asks "You need to add Segment1 to Site1." , so nothing to do with information barrier policy. To add segment1 to site 1, the approach is to use command Set-SPOSite -Identity <site URL> -AddInformationSegment <segment GUID>
Refer: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/purview/information-barriers-sharepoint

Selected Answer: C
Its actually step 3, but who is counting LOL
Than, you'd want to To: "enable information barriers in SharePoint and OneDrive with PowerShell"
PS>Set-SPOTenant -InformationBarriersSuspension $false

with love~

Selected Answer: C
Yes, it is C.
"Information barrier segments need to be linked to sites through information barrier policies."

No policy, No Honey.
